title: How to Make Chocolate Brownie Oatmeal Cookies

steps.headline: Melt 12 oz.
steps.description: (340 g) of semisweet chocolate morsels in a double boiler. If you do not have a double boiler, you can use 2 pots as long as 1 pot fits inside the other pot.

steps.headline: Beat 8 tbsp.
steps.description: (113.4 g) margarine or butter together with an 8-oz. (226.8 g) package of cream cheese. Mix the ingredients in a large bowl until the mixture is smooth and creamy.

steps.headline: Incorporate 1/2 cup (113.4 g) of the granulated sugar and 1 cup (226.8 g)of firmly packed brown sugar with your ingredients and continue to mix until both sugars are incorporated.
Add 1/2 tsp.
steps.description: (2.46 ml) of pure vanilla or vanilla extract and 2 eggs to the bowl and beat well.

steps.headline: Pour the melted chocolate into the bowl, mix well and set aside.
Combine 1 1/2 tsp.
steps.description: (7.2 g) of baking soda with 1 1/2 cups (187.5 g) all-purpose flour in a medium-sized bowl and add these ingredients to the larger bowl and mix well.

steps.headline: Measure out 3 cups (270 g) of the uncooked oats and 1 cup (150 g) of your favorite chopped nuts and stir well.
Cover the bowl tightly and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours.
Grease cookie sheets and shape the dough into 1-inch (2.5-cm) balls.
Place the cookies 3 to 3.5 inches (7.6 to 8.9 cm) apart on greased cookie sheets.
Bake cookies for 7 to 9 minutes or until the cookies are nearly set.
steps.description: The centers of the cookies should be moist.

steps.headline: Transfer the chocolate brownie oatmeal cookies to a wire rack and cool completely.
Sprinkle your cooled cookies with powdered sugar.

text: Preheat the oven to 350�F (176.66 C).  Melt 12 oz. (340 g) of semisweet chocolate morsels in a double boiler. If you do not have a double boiler, you can use 2 pots as long as 1 pot fits inside the other pot. Beat 8 tbsp. (113.4 g) margarine or butter together with an 8-oz. (226.8 g) package of cream cheese. Mix the ingredients in a large bowl until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Incorporate 1/2 cup (113.4 g) of the granulated sugar and 1 cup (226.8 g)of firmly packed brown sugar with your ingredients and continue to mix until both sugars are incorporated.  Add 1/2 tsp. (2.46 ml) of pure vanilla or vanilla extract and 2 eggs to the bowl and beat well. Pour the melted chocolate into the bowl, mix well and set aside.  Combine 1 1/2 tsp. (7.2 g) of baking soda with 1 1/2 cups (187.5 g) all-purpose flour in a medium-sized bowl and add these ingredients to the larger bowl and mix well. Measure out 3 cups (270 g) of the uncooked oats and 1 cup (150 g) of your favorite chopped nuts and stir well.  Cover the bowl tightly and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours.  Grease cookie sheets and shape the dough into 1-inch (2.5-cm) balls.  Place the cookies 3 to 3.5 inches (7.6 to 8.9 cm) apart on greased cookie sheets.  Bake cookies for 7 to 9 minutes or until the cookies are nearly set. The centers of the cookies should be moist. Transfer the chocolate brownie oatmeal cookies to a wire rack and cool completely.  Sprinkle your cooled cookies with powdered sugar.  Finished.
